column4: hi guys intenet not working for me and kern.log is flooded with messages like : Sep  7 08:01:20 kashif-pc kernel: [ 1838.939061] IN= OUT=eth0 SRC=192.168.0.101 DST=192.168.0.1 LEN=71 TOS=0x00 PREC=0x00 TTL=64 ID=57697 DF PROTO=UDP SPT=35199 DPT=53 LEN=51  wat does this mean?
hi ubottu jeep2
DPT destination port 53 is dns .. its trying to resolve a hostname
what does your /etc/resolv.conf have in it ?
thanks let me check
what os is the computer your on now ?
actually i have dual boot ,11.10 ubuntu (intenet not working) , 10.4 ubuntu ( internet working) currently i am logged in via 10.04 trying to resolve 11.04 ineternet problem
uh so what computer are you on irc from ?
which resolv.conf did you look at ?
for 10.04 (this one which is working ) i looked at resolv.conf for (11.10 not working)
the one that works ... what does /etc/resolv.conf say ?
nameserver 192.168.0.1
the one that works says "nameserver 192.168.0.1"
right .. reboot to other one and make  sure resolv.conf says that after connecting
if it does not say it then what should i do before rebooting agian and coming back here?
did you setup a firewall ?
no , i removed and reinstalled dhcp and dnsmsq
i was trying to create a hotspot for sharing internet via wifi
that explains it lol
sudo iptables -F will drop all the rules then run sudo dhclient eth0
lol , shouldn't reinstalling dnsmasq enough?
that might get you back online i havent messed with dnsmasq forever
bundle of thanks
